title: Set up CI/CD pipeline with GitHub Actions
description:
CI/CD infrastructure:
- .github/workflows/ci.yml: test, lint, build on push/PR
- .github/workflows/release.yml: GoReleaser on tag push
- .goreleaser.yml for multi-platform builds
- Coverage check enforcing 90% minimum
- Security scanning with govulncheck
- Test on ubuntu, macos, windows

title: Achieve 90% test coverage across all packages
description:
Testing milestone:
- Unit tests for all internal packages (target 95%)
- Integration tests for CLI commands
- Table-driven tests for pattern matching edge cases
- Test fixtures and helpers in internal/testutil
- Coverage report generation and verification
- Document test patterns in code comments

title: Write install.sh quick install script
description:
Quick install script:
- Detect OS (darwin/linux) and arch (amd64/arm64)
- Fetch latest release from GitHub API
- Download and extract appropriate binary
- Install to /usr/local/bin
- Verify installation with queen version

title: Implement queen config command for persistent settings
description:
Configuration management:
- queen config set <key> <value> - persist to .beads/queen_config.yaml
- queen config get <key> - retrieve value
- queen config list - show all settings
- Supported keys: droid (default identity), ttl (default reservation TTL)
- LoadConfig/SaveConfig functions in internal/config
- Update GetCurrentDroid to check config file
- Unit tests

title: Implement JSONL store with ULID ID generation
description:
Core storage layer:
- Generic JSONLStore[T] with Append, ReadAll, GetLatest methods
- ULID generation with mutex for thread safety
- ID prefixes: qm- (messages), qa- (assignments), qr- (reservations)
- Unit tests for append-only semantics and concurrent access

title: [Epic] Phase 1: Queen CLI Extensions
description:
Go binary with messaging, assignments, and file reservations CLI commands.

Deliverables:
- queen msg send/inbox/thread/reply commands
- queen assign/claim/release commands  
- queen reserve/unreserve/reserved commands
- JSONL storage for all queen_*.jsonl files
- Works across git worktrees

title: Implement droid discovery and validation
description:
Droid identity system:
- Scan .factory/droids/*.md for available droids
- ValidateDroid() with similar name suggestions on error
- GetCurrentDroid() with flag > QUEEN_DROID > FACTORY_DROID precedence
- FindBeadsDir() and FindFactoryDir() path utilities
- Unit tests for discovery and validation

title: Implement beads integration for issue validation
description:
Beads integration:
- ReadIssues() to parse issues.jsonl or beads.jsonl
- ValidateIssueExists() for assignment/message issue references
- BeadsIssue type with relevant fields
- Unit tests

title: [Epic] Phase 4: Integration Testing
description:
End-to-end validation of multi-agent workflows.

Scenarios:
- Basic workflow (epic → decompose → assign → work → complete)
- Multi-worktree coordination
- Conflict resolution
- Escalation to human

title: Implement assignment storage and CLI commands
description:
Assignment tracking:
- Assignment type with status lifecycle (active/completed/released/reassigned)
- AssignmentStore with Assign, Claim, Release, GetActiveForIssue, GetActiveForDroid
- Enforce single active assignment per issue
- CLI commands: queen assign/claim/release/assignments
- Flags: --worktree, --reason, --droid, --status, --json
- Unit and integration tests

title: Implement reservation storage and CLI commands
description:
File reservation system:
- Reservation type with TTL (expires_at), exclusive flag
- ReservationStore with Reserve, Release, ReleaseAll, GetActive, CheckPath
- Glob pattern matching with PatternsOverlap() using doublestar
- Conflict detection for overlapping exclusive reservations
- CLI commands: queen reserve/reserved/unreserve
- Flags: --issue, --ttl, --exclusive, --reason, --path, --all, --json
- Default TTL: 2 hours
- Unit and integration tests

title: [Epic] Phase 2: Queen Droid
description:
Factory droid for automated orchestration.

Deliverables:
- Queen droid definition (.factory/droids/queen.md) - DONE
- Epic decomposition logic
- Task assignment algorithm
- Conflict resolution
- Daemon mode (queen start/stop)

title: [Epic] Phase 3: Unified TUI
description:
Single TUI for issues, messages, reservations, worktrees.

Deliverables:
- Fork bv/bdui as queenui
- Issue panel with assignments
- Message panel with threads
- Reservation panel
- Droid status panel
- Multi-worktree tabs

title: Implement message storage and CLI commands
description:
Messaging system:
- Message type with threading (issue_id, reply_to, thread_id)
- MessageStore with Send, MarkRead, GetInbox, GetThread, GetByID
- CLI commands: queen msg send/inbox/reply/read/thread
- Flags: --issue, --subject, --importance, --unread, --since, --json
- Unit and integration tests

title: Set up queen Go module and project structure
description:
Initialize Go module at github.com/tjboudreaux/queenbee with:
- go.mod with dependencies (cobra, ulid, color, doublestar)
- Directory structure: cmd/queen, internal/{cli,store,messages,assignments,reservations,droids,config,beads}
- Makefile with build, test, lint targets
- Basic main.go with version command
close_reason: Implemented: Go module initialized with CLI scaffolding, version command working

title: Create Homebrew formula for queen CLI
description:
Homebrew distribution:
- Create homebrew-queenbee tap repository
- Formula/queen.rb with platform detection
- SHA256 checksums for release artifacts
- Installation and test instructions
- Update release workflow to auto-update formula
